definition: lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)

sentences.english: At this time of the year farmers to capalternating currentity to plow their fields.
sentences.chinese: 每年這個時辰，農民們濫觴犁地。

sentences.english: It was inital and taking shape stage about the Peach culture before the Qin Dynasty and Wei Jin Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 先秦至魏晉是桃文化的濫觴和形成期。

sentences.english: People did stgood to wonder how long the disaster would last.
sentences.chinese: 人們濫觴煩懣，這場災難還會延續多久？

sentences.english: The ancient mathematics of China was from the outset of remarkable political utilitarianism.
sentences.chinese: 中國古代數學從濫觴之時就表現出明顯的政治功利性。

sentences.english: Storytelling novels originated from the works of folklore speakers and marketplace writers.
sentences.chinese: 話本小說濫觴於說話藝人和市井文人之作。

sentences.english: The movie commenced when we got there.
sentences.chinese: 我們一到那兒電影就濫觴了。

sentences.english: THE crisis began on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 本次全球金融風暴，濫觴於美國華爾街。

definition: to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
to acclaim/to sing the praises of

notes on poetry, an essay genre consisting of informal commentary on poems and poets and their lives (old)/a genre of narrative literature interspersing prose with poetry, popular in the Tang and Song dynasties
to look at sth through a bamboo tube/to have a restricted view
to comment/a point by point commentary
to pass on the light of Buddha
Ji Yun (1724-1805), Qing Dynasty writer, author of supernatural novel Notes on a Minutely Observed Thatched Hut 閱微草堂筆記|阅微草堂笔记
